children.name: the kind of life that sb has
lifestyle
children.definition: the way sb lives and behaves, and the type of things they buy, eat etc: cách sống, lối sống
examples: a healthy lifestylemột lối sống lành mạnh
You really need to think about leading a healthier lifestyle.
lavish/luxurious lifestyle
[the lifestyle of someone who is very rich] lối sống xa hoa / sang trọng
Hurst’s lavish lifestyle is the stuff of legend.
extravagant lifestyle[a lifestyle that shows people how rich you are] lối sống xa hoa
Even when in debt, he continued to enjoy an extravagant lifestyle.

children.name: life
children.definition: the kind of life that sb has: cuộc sống
examples: Having a baby completely changes your life.
quality of life[the level of health, comfort and pleasure in someone’s life] chất lượng cuộc sống
By our actions today, we can improve the quality of life for future generations.
a better life
Immigrating to the UK was their only chance for a better life.
a life of crime[when you make money by committing crimes instead of having a normal job]
He left school at 15, quickly turning to a life of crime.
lead a happy/ quiet/ exciting etc life
We’ve led a very quiet life since Ralph retired.
lead a busy/ normal/ quiet, etc. life[to live a particular type of life] trải qua
He was able to lead a normal life, despite the illness.
We certainly don't lead a life of luxury but we're not poor either.

children.name: a happy/ busy/ exciting etc life
examples: Debbie has a really busy life, doesn’t she?
They enjoyed a full and happy life together until his death in June l999.

children.name: way of life
children.definition: the way in which a person or group of people lives, and the type of things they usually do: lối sống, cách sống
examples: sb’s way of life
‘How can we abandon our way of life?’ asked the old sheep herder. ‘It’s all we know.’
become a way of life
Casual dress has become a way of life in corporate Britain.
the British/ German/ American etc way of life
Shopping is an important part of the American way of life.

children.name: existence
children.definition: the life that sb has, especially when they have difficult or bad experiences: sự tồn tại, sự sống
examples: lead a miserable/lonely etc existence[have a particular existence]
The workers lived a miserable existence and were treated like serfs.

children.name: a lonely/ miserable/ unhappy etc existence
examples: Elena faced a lonely existence in the big city.

children.name: live well
children.definition: / happily/ carefully etc to live your life in a particular way:
examples: Tom and Linda both earn good salaries -they live well and have a nice home.
One can live cheaply in London, although it’s not easy.

children.name: quality of life
children.definition: how good or bad your life is, shown for example by whether or not you are happy, healthy, able to do what you want etc : chất lượng cuộc sống
examples: My quality of life has improved tremendously since I moved to the country.
drugs that improve the quality of life for very ill patients.

children.name: culture
children.definition: all the customs, beliefs, and practices of a particular society or among a particular group of people: văn hóa
examples: The trip offers you a unique opportunity to experience the culture of the remote hill tribes of the north.
In what ways do British and Australian culture differ?
cultural[usually attri adj] [B1] belonging or relating to a particular society and its way of life
the very real historical andcultural differencesbetween our two societies
the desire to maintain a distinctcultural identity
It is important to look at the political andcultural contextin which the novel was written.
people who share the samecultural background
cultural heritage/ traditions etc[ideas, customs etc that have existed in a particular society for a long time]
Japan’s unique cultural heritage
culturally[adv] [B2]
a culturally diverse society.
